intro: Foenodorum, commonly known as the sweet cicely, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces aromatic seeds that are often used in culinary and medicinal applications. Native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its growth habit includes a short, stout rootstock and a flowering period typically in late spring to early summer.
